metadata.Title: CVE-2017-5617 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
The SVG Salamander (aka svgSalamander) library, when used in a web application, allows remote attackers to conduct server-side request forgery (SSRF) attacks via an xlink:href attribute in an SVG file.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-5617` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libsvgsalamander-java - 0~svn95-1+deb8u1build0.16.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: svgsalamander package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '0~svn95-1+deb8u1build0.16.04.1').
